problem_names:
lemma abs_majorities_intersect:
    assumes crd: "card E < card S + card T"
        and s: "S \<subseteq> E" and t: "T \<subseteq> E" and e: "finite E"
    shows "S \<inter> T \<noteq> {}"

lemma abs_majoritiesE:
  assumes crd: "card E < card S + card T"
      and s: "S \<subseteq> E" and t: "T \<subseteq> E" and e: "finite E"
  obtains p where "p \<in> S" and "p \<in> T"

lemma abs_majoritiesE':
  assumes Smaj: "card S > (card E) div 2" and Tmaj: "card T > (card E) div 2"
      and s: "S \<subseteq> E" and t: "T \<subseteq> E" and e: "finite E"
  obtains p where "p \<in> S" and "p \<in> T"

lemma majorities_intersect:
  assumes crd: "card (UNIV::('a::finite) set) < card (S::'a set) + card T"
  shows "S \<inter> T \<noteq> {}"

lemma majoritiesE:
  assumes crd: "card (UNIV::('a::finite) set) < card (S::'a set) + card (T::'a set)"
  obtains p where "p \<in> S" and "p \<in> T"

lemma majoritiesE':
  assumes S: "card (S::('a::finite) set) > (card (UNIV::'a set)) div 2"
  and T: "card (T::'a set) > (card (UNIV::'a set)) div 2"
  obtains p where "p \<in> S" and "p \<in> T"
translations:
lemma abs_majorities_intersect:
    assumes crd: "card E < card S + card T"
        and s: "S \<subseteq> E" and t: "T \<subseteq> E" and e: "finite E"
    shows "S \<inter> T \<noteq> {}"
proof (clarify)

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. S \<inter> T = {} \<Longrightarrow> False
assume contra: "S \<inter> T = {}"

proof (state)
this:
  S \<inter> T = {}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. S \<inter> T = {} \<Longrightarrow> False
from s t e

proof (chain)
picking this:
  S \<subseteq> E
  T \<subseteq> E
  finite E
have "finite S" and "finite T"

proof (prove)
using this:
  S \<subseteq> E
  T \<subseteq> E
  finite E

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. finite S &&& finite T
by (auto simp: finite_subset)

proof (state)
this:
  finite S
  finite T

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. S \<inter> T = {} \<Longrightarrow> False
with crd contra

proof (chain)
picking this:
  card E < card S + card T
  S \<inter> T = {}
  finite S
  finite T
have "card E < card (S \<union> T)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  card E < card S + card T
  S \<inter> T = {}
  finite S
  finite T

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. card E < card (S \<union> T)
by (auto simp add: card_Un_Int)

proof (state)
this:
  card E < card (S \<union> T)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. S \<inter> T = {} \<Longrightarrow> False
moreover

proof (state)
this:
  card E < card (S \<union> T)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. S \<inter> T = {} \<Longrightarrow> False
from s t e

proof (chain)
picking this:
  S \<subseteq> E
  T \<subseteq> E
  finite E
have "card (S \<union> T) \<le> card E"

proof (prove)
using this:
  S \<subseteq> E
  T \<subseteq> E
  finite E

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. card (S \<union> T) \<le> card E
by (simp add: card_mono)

proof (state)
this:
  card (S \<union> T) \<le> card E

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. S \<inter> T = {} \<Longrightarrow> False
ultimately

proof (chain)
picking this:
  card E < card (S \<union> T)
  card (S \<union> T) \<le> card E
show "False"

proof (prove)
using this:
  card E < card (S \<union> T)
  card (S \<union> T) \<le> card E

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. False
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  False

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

lemma abs_majoritiesE:
  assumes crd: "card E < card S + card T"
      and s: "S \<subseteq> E" and t: "T \<subseteq> E" and e: "finite E"
  obtains p where "p \<in> S" and "p \<in> T"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>p.
        \<lbrakk>p \<in> S; p \<in> T\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>p.
        \<lbrakk>p \<in> S; p \<in> T\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
from assms

proof (chain)
picking this:
  card E < card S + card T
  S \<subseteq> E
  T \<subseteq> E
  finite E
have "S \<inter> T \<noteq> {}"

proof (prove)
using this:
  card E < card S + card T
  S \<subseteq> E
  T \<subseteq> E
  finite E

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. S \<inter> T \<noteq> {}
by (rule abs_majorities_intersect)

proof (state)
this:
  S \<inter> T \<noteq> {}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>p.
        \<lbrakk>p \<in> S; p \<in> T\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
then
obtain p where "p \<in> S \<inter> T"

proof (prove)
using this:
  S \<inter> T \<noteq> {}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>p.
        p \<in> S \<inter> T \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
by blast

proof (state)
this:
  p \<in> S \<inter> T

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>p.
        \<lbrakk>p \<in> S; p \<in> T\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
with that

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<lbrakk>?p \<in> S; ?p \<in> T\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> thesis
  p \<in> S \<inter> T
show ?thesis

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<lbrakk>?p \<in> S; ?p \<in> T\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> thesis
  p \<in> S \<inter> T

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. thesis
by auto

proof (state)
this:
  thesis

goal:
No subgoals!
qed
text \<open>Special case: both sets \<open>S\<close> and \<open>T\<close> are majorities.\<close>

lemma abs_majoritiesE':
  assumes Smaj: "card S > (card E) div 2" and Tmaj: "card T > (card E) div 2"
      and s: "S \<subseteq> E" and t: "T \<subseteq> E" and e: "finite E"
  obtains p where "p \<in> S" and "p \<in> T"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>p.
        \<lbrakk>p \<in> S; p \<in> T\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
proof (rule abs_majoritiesE[OF _ s t e])

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. (\<And>p.
        \<lbrakk>p \<in> S; p \<in> T\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    card E < card S + card T
 2. \<And>p.
       \<lbrakk>\<And>p.
                   \<lbrakk>p \<in> S; p \<in> T\<rbrakk>
                   \<Longrightarrow> thesis;
        p \<in> S; p \<in> T\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> thesis
from Smaj Tmaj

proof (chain)
picking this:
  card E div 2 < card S
  card E div 2 < card T
show "card E < card S + card T"

proof (prove)
using this:
  card E div 2 < card S
  card E div 2 < card T

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. card E < card S + card T
by auto

proof (state)
this:
  card E < card S + card T

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>p.
       \<lbrakk>\<And>p.
                   \<lbrakk>p \<in> S; p \<in> T\<rbrakk>
                   \<Longrightarrow> thesis;
        p \<in> S; p \<in> T\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> thesis
qed

text \<open>
  We restate the above theorems for the case where the base type
  is finite (taking \<open>E\<close> as the universal set).
\<close>

lemma majorities_intersect:
  assumes crd: "card (UNIV::('a::finite) set) < card (S::'a set) + card T"
  shows "S \<inter> T \<noteq> {}"
by (rule abs_majorities_intersect[OF crd]) auto

lemma majoritiesE:
  assumes crd: "card (UNIV::('a::finite) set) < card (S::'a set) + card (T::'a set)"
  obtains p where "p \<in> S" and "p \<in> T"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>p.
        \<lbrakk>p \<in> S; p \<in> T\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
using crd majorities_intersect

proof (prove)
using this:
  card UNIV < card S + card T
  card UNIV < card ?S + card ?T \<Longrightarrow> ?S \<inter> ?T \<noteq> {}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>p.
        \<lbrakk>p \<in> S; p \<in> T\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
by blast

lemma majoritiesE':
  assumes S: "card (S::('a::finite) set) > (card (UNIV::'a set)) div 2"
  and T: "card (T::'a set) > (card (UNIV::'a set)) div 2"
  obtains p where "p \<in> S" and "p \<in> T"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>p.
        \<lbrakk>p \<in> S; p \<in> T\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
by (rule abs_majoritiesE'[OF S T]) auto
end
(* theory Majorities *)
